definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: Promoting literacy is one of Laura Bush's main projects as first lady.
sentences.chinese: 推广读写能力是萝拉身为第一夫人的主要计画。

sentences.english: This stream refreshes the pool of minimally literate Americans.
sentences.chinese: 这个潮流使得读写能力最低的美国人大量增加。

sentences.english: Although he had had little formal education, he could read and write well.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他接受很少正规教育，但他的读写能力佷好。

sentences.english: Nearly 99 percent of Albanians are literate.
sentences.chinese: 近99%的阿国国民具备读写能力。

sentences.english: Their reading ability is at level one or two.
sentences.chinese: 都存在文化素养问题，他们的读写能力很低。

sentences.english: Language and literacy are among greatests greatest s.
sentences.chinese: 语言和读写能力是人类的最伟大发明。

sentences.english: For example, the Maester gains the Literacy Feat upon acquiring 1st Level.
sentences.chinese: 学士在第1级获得读写能力专长。

sentences.english: In the meantime, here are 5 simple ways you can promote reading and literacy.
sentences.chinese: 同时，这里有5种简单的方式提高你的读写能力。

sentences.english: There is a crisis of literacy in this country.
sentences.chinese: 在美国存在着读写能力的危机。

sentences.english: Pass English band 6 test, and can read and write in English well.
sentences.chinese: 通过英语六级测试，有很好的读写能力。

definition: English Language Teaching (ELT)/studying and teaching English
